intro: Sanicula canadensis var. canadensis, commonly known as Canadian snakeroot, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It features a slender, branched stem that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in moist woodlands and along streambanks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
